dublin_core.dcvalue: The increasing bureaucracy of health care has had a serious negative impact on physicians and patients for the last fifteen years We report an example of this trend involving the interstate interpretation of dermatopathology specimens which resulted in a significant interruption of diagnostic services to a large number of dermatologists Temporary and long term solutions are discussed with the hope that dialogue and political consensus building can bring resolution to the problem
Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology
